CLAUDE.md

Source: CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

Project Overview

couplr (formerly lapr) is an R package for solving Linear Assignment Problems (LAP) with production-ready matching workflows. The package combines:

  • 20 LAP algorithms - Hungarian, Jonker-Volgenant, Auction (3 variants), Network Simplex, Orlin-Ahuja, Push-Relabel, and more
  • Greedy matching - Fast approximate algorithms for large-scale problems
  • Automatic preprocessing - Smart scaling, variable health checks, categorical encoding
  • Balance diagnostics - Standardized differences, variance ratios, KS tests
  • Distance caching - Reusable precomputed distances for faster experimentation
  • Parallel processing - Distributed block matching via the future framework
  • Joined datasets - Analysis-ready merged output with broom-style interface

Current version: 1.0.0 | Tests: 1382 passing | License: MIT

Development Commands

System Configuration (Windows)

# R paths
"C:\Program Files\R\R-4.5.2\bin\Rscript.exe" script.R
"C:\Program Files\R\R-4.5.2\bin\Rscript.exe" -e "command"

Core Package Development

devtools::load_all()           # Load package (recompiles C++ if needed)
devtools::test()               # Run all 1382 tests
devtools::test(filter = "matching")  # Run specific tests
devtools::document()           # Build documentation
devtools::check()              # Full package check

C++ Development Workflow

After modifying C++ code or adding [[Rcpp::export]] functions:

Rcpp::compileAttributes()  # REQUIRED after C++ changes
devtools::document()
devtools::load_all()
devtools::test()

Critical: C++17 required. Windows: Rtools with g++ supporting C++17.

Troubleshooting:

Remove-Item src\*.o, src\*.dll -Force  # Clean stale object files
R CMD INSTALL --clean .

Building the pkgdown Website

"C:\Program Files\R\R-4.5.2\bin\Rscript.exe" build_site.R

The build script runs pkgdown::build_site() then post-processes SVGs for dark mode support.

Key files: build_site.R, pkgdown/extra.css, _pkgdown.yml

Theme colors (Sandstone Bootstrap 5): - Light: bg=#F5F6F8, border=#DFD7CA, text=#3E3F3A - Dark: bg=#343739, border=#495057, text=#DFD7CA

Code Architecture

Three-Layer API Design

Layer 1 - Low-level LAP solvers (R/assignment.R): - assignment() - Core solver returning list(match, total_cost, status, method_used) - Method auto-selection via method = "auto"

Layer 2 - Tidy LAP interface (R/lap_solve.R): - lap_solve() - Returns tibble with tidy output - lap_solve_batch(), lap_solve_kbest() for batch/k-best solving

Layer 3 - Matching workflows: - match_couples() - Optimal one-to-one matching (R/matching_core.R) - greedy_couples() - Fast greedy matching (3 strategies) - matchmaker() - Blocking/stratification (R/matching_blocks.R) - balance_diagnostics() - Balance assessment (R/matching_diagnostics.R) - preprocess_matching_vars() - Variable health checks (R/matching_preprocessing.R) - compute_distances() - Distance caching (R/matching_distance_cache.R) - join_matched() - Merged datasets (R/matching_join.R)

Core Matching Workflow

# 1. Optional: Create blocks
blocks <- matchmaker(left, right, block_type = "group", block_by = "site")

# 2. Match with preprocessing
result <- match_couples(
  left, right,
  vars = c("age", "income", "education"),
  auto_scale = TRUE, scale = "robust", max_distance = 0.5
)

# 3. Assess balance
balance <- balance_diagnostics(result, left, right, vars)
balance_table(balance)  # Publication-ready

R File Structure (20 files)

R/
├── couplr-package.R, data.R, zzz.R, RcppExports.R, utils.R
├── LAP: lap_solve.R, lap_solve_batch.R, lap_solve_kbest.R
├── Matching: matching_core.R (625 lines), matching_distance.R,
│   matching_distance_cache.R, matching_constraints.R, matching_blocks.R,
│   matching_parallel.R, matching_utils.R, matching_messages.R
├── Analysis: matching_preprocessing.R (510), matching_diagnostics.R (461),
│   matching_join.R (220)
└── Morphing: morph_pixel.R, morph_tiling.R, morph_utils.R

Key Matching Features

  1. Automatic Preprocessing - Detects constant vars (excludes), high missingness (warns), extreme skewness (info). Scaling: “robust” (MAD), “standardize” (SD), “range”. Categorical encoding for binary/ordered factors.

  2. Greedy Algorithms - sorted (sort pairs, assign), row_best (row-by-row), pq (priority queue). 10-100x faster than optimal.

  3. Balance Diagnostics - Standardized differences, variance ratios, KS tests. Thresholds: <0.1 excellent, 0.1-0.25 good, 0.25-0.5 acceptable, >0.5 poor.

  4. Blocking - Exact: block_type = "group" + block_by. K-means: block_type = "cluster" + n_clusters.

C++ Code Organization

src/
├── core/: lap_internal.h, lap_utils.cpp/.h
├── interface/: prepare_cost_matrix.cpp
├── solvers/ (20+ files): greedy_matching.cpp, solve_auction.cpp,
│   solve_hungarian.cpp, solve_jv.cpp, solve_murty.cpp, solve_push_relabel.cpp,
│   solve_ramshaw_tarjan.cpp, etc.
├── solvers/network_simplex/: ns_types.h, ns_graph.h, ns_init.h, ns_pivot.h,
│   solve_network_simplex.cpp
├── solvers/orlin_ahuja/: orlin_types.h, orlin_*.h
├── gabow_tarjan/: solve_gabow_tarjan.cpp, utils_gabow_tarjan.cpp/.h
├── morph/: morph_pixel_level.cpp, region_means.cpp
├── rcpp_interface.cpp  # ALL [[Rcpp::export]] declarations
└── RcppExports.cpp     # Auto-generated, DO NOT EDIT

Export Pattern (CRITICAL):

Subdirectory files do NOT use [[Rcpp::export]] directly:

  1. Implementation in subdirectory with _impl suffix
  2. Forward declaration in src/rcpp_interface.cpp
  3. Exported wrapper in src/rcpp_interface.cpp with [[Rcpp::export]]

Why: Rcpp only scans root src/*.cpp files.

LAP Algorithms

Optimal solvers (20 methods): - jv - Jonker-Volgenant (general, fast) - hungarian - Classic Hungarian - auction / auction_gs / auction_scaled - Auction variants - ssp / sap - Shortest augmenting path - csflow - Cost-scaling flow - csa - Goldberg-Kennedy cost-scaling (often fastest for medium-large) - cycle_cancel - Cycle canceling with Karp - gabow_tarjan - Complementary slackness - ssap_bucket - Dial’s algorithm (integer costs) - lapmod - Sparse JV variant (>50% forbidden entries) - network_simplex - Network simplex with spanning tree - orlin - Orlin-Ahuja O(sqrt(n) * m * log(nC)) - push_relabel - Push-relabel max-flow based - ramshaw_tarjan - Optimized for rectangular matrices - hk01 - Hopcroft-Karp (binary/uniform costs) - line_metric - 1D matching O(n log n) - bruteforce - Exhaustive (n ≤ 8) - auto - Automatic selection based on problem characteristics

Greedy approximations: - greedy_sorted / greedy_row_best / greedy_pq - 10-100x faster than optimal

Specialized functions: - assignment_duals() - Returns dual variables (u, v) for sensitivity analysis - bottleneck_assignment() - Minimize maximum edge cost (minimax) - sinkhorn() - Entropy-regularized optimal transport (soft assignment)

Testing

CRITICAL: Test files MUST be in tests/testthat/

tests/
├── testthat.R           # Test runner
└── testthat/            # ALL test files here
    ├── test-matching.R  # 98 matching tests
    ├── test-assignment-*.R  # 20+ solver test files
    └── test-*.R

❌ Test files in package root or tests/ directly are IGNORED by devtools::test()

devtools::test()                    # Run all
devtools::test(filter = "matching") # Filter
testthat::test_file("tests/testthat/test-matching.R")  # Specific file

Important Conventions

Indexing

  • R: 1-based | C++: 0-based (convert at boundaries)
  • Unmatched: -1 (C++) / 0 or NA (R)

Matrix Orientation

  • Rows = left/treatment, Cols = right/control
  • Auto-transpose if rows > cols

Cost Matrix

  • NA or Inf = forbidden assignment
  • maximize = TRUE negates internally, returns original scale

Return Values

LAP Solvers:

list(match = integer, total_cost = numeric, status = "optimal", method_used = "name")

Matching Functions:

list(
  pairs = tibble(left_id, right_id, distance, block_id),
  info = list(method, strategy, n_matched, total_distance, n_blocks),
  # If return_diagnostics = TRUE:
  left_unmatched, right_unmatched, cost_matrix, distance_info
)

Balance Diagnostics:

list(var_stats = tibble(...), overall = list(...), n_matched, has_blocks, block_stats)

Adding New Functionality

New LAP Solver

  1. Create src/solvers/solve_foo.cpp with solve_foo_impl()
  2. Forward declare in src/rcpp_interface.cpp
  3. Add [[Rcpp::export]] wrapper in src/rcpp_interface.cpp
  4. Run Rcpp::compileAttributes()
  5. Add case in assignment() (R/assignment.R)
  6. Create tests/testthat/test-assignment-foo.R
  7. Run devtools::document()

Matching Features

  • Preprocessing: Edit R/matching_preprocessing.R
  • Diagnostics: Edit R/matching_diagnostics.R
  • New algorithms: C++ in src/solvers/, export via rcpp_interface.cpp, R wrapper in R/matching_core.R

Common Pitfalls

  1. Forgetting Rcpp::compileAttributes() - “could not find function” errors
  2. Exporting from subdirectories - DON’T put [[Rcpp::export]] in src/solvers/*.cpp
  3. Test files in wrong location - Must be in tests/testthat/
  4. 0-based vs 1-based indexing - Convert at R/C++ boundary
  5. Rectangular matrices - Test with nrow != ncol
  6. NA/Inf costs - Test forbidden edges
  7. Package name - OLD: lapr, NEW: couplr
  8. Stale object files - Clean with Remove-Item src\*.o, src\*.dll -Force

Special Notes

Pixel Morphing

Modes: exact (< 4096 pixels), color_walk (quantization + LAPs), recursive (2×2 tiling)

CRITICAL: Assignment uses both images A and B. Renderer uses ONLY A’s colors. B influences WHERE pixels go, not WHAT colors.

Cost Computation

All solvers MUST use compute_total_cost() from src/core/lap_utils.cpp. Never compute from transformed matrices.

Backward Compatibility

v1.0.0 is 100% backward compatible. All new parameters default to previous behavior.

Package Dependencies

Required: R ≥ 3.5.0, C++17, Rcpp, RcppEigen, tibble, dplyr, rlang, purrr, magrittr

Optional: testthat, knitr, rmarkdown, bench, future, future.apply, magick, png

Quick Reference Workflows

Basic Matching

result <- match_couples(left, right, vars = c("age", "income"), auto_scale = TRUE)
balance <- balance_diagnostics(result, left, right, vars)
data <- join_matched(result, left, right)

Greedy (Large Data)

result <- greedy_couples(left, right, vars, strategy = "row_best", auto_scale = TRUE)

Blocking

blocks <- matchmaker(left, right, block_type = "group", block_by = "site")
result <- match_couples(left, right, vars, block_id = blocks$block_id, parallel = TRUE)

Distance Caching

dist_obj <- compute_distances(left, right, vars, scale = "robust")
result1 <- match_couples(dist_obj, max_distance = 0.3)
result2 <- match_couples(dist_obj, max_distance = 0.5)

LAP Solving

cost <- matrix(c(1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9), nrow = 3)
result <- lap_solve(cost, method = "auto")

More info: browseVignettes("couplr") | ?match_couples | https://github.com/gcol33/couplr/issues
